question: 差す
sourceAnswer: to:shine | to-be:visible | to-be:tinged-with | to:{rise-(of-water-levels)/flow-in} | to:{be-felt-(i.e.-as-an-emotion)/come-over-one} | to{}{hold-up-(an-umbrella,-etc.)/put-up/raise} | to{}extend-one's-arm-straight-ahead-(in-dance) | to{}{insert/put-in} | to{}{wear-(a-sword)-in-one's-belt/wear-at-one's-side/carry-under-one's-arm} | to{}insert-one's-arm-under-an-opponent's-arm | to{}pole-(a-boat) | to{}{pour/add-(liquid)/serve-(drinks)} | to{}{put-on-(lipstick,-etc.)/apply/colour/dye} | to{}{light-(a-fire)/burn} | to{}{shut/close/lock/fasten} | to{?}{stop-in-the-midst-of/leave-undone}
userAnswer: <tag><ja>刺す</ja>,<ja>指す</ja></tag> to{:} :{ shine/come-out/fall-on | be-visible | rise/flow-in} | {}{ hold-up/raise | insert/put-in | pour}
activeAnswer: <tag><ja>刺す</ja>,<ja>指す</ja></tag> to{:} :{ shine/come-out/fall-on | be-visible | rise/flow-in} | {}{ hold-up/raise | insert/put-in | pour}
sourceMnemonic: The kanji is <kanji>distinction</kanji>. To distinct something would be nice, but this is used more like <vocabulary>to shine at</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to shine on</vocabulary>, like when a light shines on someone on a stage, distinguishing them from everyone else.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading of the kanji is actually the same as the reading for this word, making things easy (both on'yomi and kun'yomi are <ja>さ</ja>).
